channel.title: Moparscape Modeling Contest #6[Armor Set]
channel.description:
[u][B]Model Contest #6[/B][/u]
It's a simple contest really; you submit a model, as well as others, and the judges pick what we feel to be the best model. The model may be Created in any [i]3Dimensional Modeling Program[/i], which means no photoshop, or model generator programs. [b]All models [i]must[/i] be RuneScape Client-Capable (Poly Wise). - NO NPC Models[/b]
[b][size=18pt]DO NOT post unless it is your model entry. If this receives as much spam as the last one, I will ask a moderator to lock this. DO NOT post unless it is your model entry(s). Should I get this locked, it means that the contest is over. This is your only warning.[/size][/b]
[b]Contest Closes On:[/b][Color=red]November 12, 2010 at 9:00 PM PST [/color]
[b]Placement[/b] 1st. 2nd. 3rd.
[b]Top Three(no specific order)[/b] 1. 2. 3.
[u]Model Requirements:[/u]Suit of Armor: a.Helmet b.Chest plate c.Leggings
[B]Rules[/b] 1. Any model posted must be made by you. 2. You may post up to TWO sets. 3. Multiple Views Required, as well as a render. 4. Wire frame mandatory. We do judge the model based on the Polygon Flow. 5. NO SUB-SURFACING/Smoothing, we want to see YOUR Skill, not the "Subsurface/Smooth" tools skills. 6. Anyone posting another persons work will be disqualified and banned from current/future participation. 7. Do not just trace a model, reference images are ok. Those who trace an image will be disadvantaged against those who did not. 8. No previously posted models. 9. Do NOT post/release the model before the contest winner is announced. 10.You can only win the contest [i]every [s]second[/s] [b]third[/b] time[/i] so that others have a chance. 11.No textures. Every program has different texturing capabilities and I feel it is an unfair advantage to those using more professional programs than Metasequoia. 12.[b]NO RECOLORS[/b] The model cannot be a model which in any way, is not yours. No JAGeX models. No Model Bases. No 'stretched' god swords, etc. You can enter them, but your model wont be considered. 13.The Top Three must provide a download link to the Judges through PM. 14.All models are to be in Quad's (Rectangles), not Triangles and Equal to/below [b]1,000 faces EACH PIECE of armor[/b]. This will make it easier for us to see how it was built by wire frame. Anyone posting a triangulated model will be asked to convert it to squares, if possible. No points lost. To Clear the Polygon Limit disputes up: 1 000 Quads 2 000 Tri. *1 000 Quads = 2 000 Triangulated poly.
[B]How The Model's Are Judged[/B]
The Point system will be used to judge the Top Three models only, but this system applies to all models. How its marked User's Score:
1.Appearance 25 Points /25 2.Polygon Flow 20 Points /20 3.Unique Style 15 Points /15 4.Use of Primitives 10 Points /10 5.Overall Appearance 10 Points /10 6.Proportion 10 Points /10 7.Detail 10 Points /10
[table][tr][td]
I know by now your wondering, alright so [i]what is the prize?[/i] As the winner of the model contest, your model will be stickied in the section up until the next contest winner is announced. While this may seem insignificant to some, think of the publicity and respect others will show you?
[b]The armor does [i]not[/i] need to be animated. If you wish to animate it, go for it. The winner only needs to release the .mqo
Judges CANNOT enter.
[b]Judges[/b] 1. Dylan (Dylan_0789) 2. Tribbinator 3. Man_Killerx[/td][/tr][/table]

item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ

item.title: Moparscape Modeling Contest #6[Armor Set]
item.dc:creator: @brandonscarinfo brandonscarinfo
item.description:
@brandonscarinfo wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:42, topic:365518”]Alright guys, I know the contest is over and shit but I felt like modeling something, so here’s a quick “futuristic” armour. As I said I felt like modeling wich means I only modeled, I did not take time to color the model. Also, the helmet and the body are not welded together. This model has about 5000 triangles. I know there’s a 2000 triangle limit BUT I THINK that since the peaces are splitted in 3 parts (body, leggings and helmet), runescape allows you up to 6000 triangles (2000 on each part ofcourse), I would appreciate if someone could confirm this.

[/quote]

ok only one thought came to mind when I saw this. Samus?
lol, this looks very good though man, great job. this would have definitely won if was entered on time >.<

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“the wanderer, post:43, topic:365518”]Polygon flow is perfect man. No triangles. Besides that circle part. :P. Helmet reminds me of a halo helmet. And the limit for this contest was 1000 per piece. 1000 for helmet, 1000 for platebody, 1000 for platelegs. I myself made sleeves 1000, since they are separate on the platebody, but yeah.[/quote]Thank you, the polygon flow is perfect due to primitive modeling, this is 100% done in primitives, the helmet has not a perfect polygon flow because it is made out of a sphere.

As I said I felt like modeling wich means I only modeled, I did not take time to color the model. Also, the helmet and the body are not welded together. This model has about 5000 triangles. I know there’s a 2000 triangle limit BUT I THINK that since the peaces are splitted in 3 parts (body, leggings and helmet), runescape allows you up to 6000 triangles (2000 on each part ofcourse), I would appreciate if someone could confirm this.

item.title: Moparscape Modeling Contest #6[Armor Set]
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

I know I am not a judge but I feel like grading it

The Wanderer’s armor set:
1.Appearance
25 Points 15/25 Its not that it is bad, it just looks like something runescape would of already made, I mean I know its a contest for RS models but still, could of been a bit more creative on the coloring.
2.Polygon Flow
20 Points 18/20 Erm I do think the flow is wonderful, I mean you could of used less poly in some spots, but for the flow its nice.
3.Unique Style
15 Points 10/15 Kind of the same stuff as I said before, it looks like something you would find in runescape already, which is a good and bad thing.
4.Use of Primitives
10 Points 9/10 Very good use, real clean to look at.
5.Overall Appearance
10 Points 9/10 Erm the idea is what makes it the best, just from looking at it and thinking it was already in runescape and you just leeched it, I think is what made this stand out to me.
6.Proportion
10 Points 6/10 Its alright, it looks as if the guy inside was a little chubby lol, but the way the stomach is shape doesn’t seem right to me, the chest is fine though.
7.Detail
10 Points 9/10 I think its good, I mean the model I wish I could see in game.
8.Total -------
100 Points 76/100 Good job mate.

Read full topic

item.description:

Thanks. I wish more people entered…

item.title: Moparscape Modeling Contest #6[Armor Set]
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

The Wanderer’s armor set:
1.Appearance
25 Points 17/25 Not bad. Could use work.
2.Polygon Flow
20 Points 16/20 Excessive in certain areas.
3.Unique Style
15 Points 11/15 Fairly unique. Too much resemblance to Barrows.
4.Use of Primitives
10 Points 9/10 Decent.
5.Overall Appearance
10 Points 7/10 The overall effect was OK but could use improvements.
6.Proportion
10 Points 7/10 First glance was OK. After looking more closely the proportions seemed off.
7.Detail
10 Points 7/10 Decent. Not bad for a RS model.
8.Total -------
100 Points 74/100 Pretty good.

There. Please note that I marked it harder than I did the origional contests as the model suggested more skill than the previous contests. Good job.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Modeling Contest #6[Armor Set]
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“man_killerx, post:26, topic:365518”] -the wanderer-
1.Appearance
25 Points 22 /25 Some areas are too flat, And uneven.
2.Polygon Flow
20 Points 17 /20 Pretty good and it is in quads. But some areas have unneeded polygons.
3.Unique Style
15 Points 10/15 Barrows in general really is not uniqe, And the helm looks like guthans.
4.Use of Primitives
10 Points 4/10 I didn’t see any used on the model (Besides cones for the spikes.)
5.Overall Appearance
10 Points 8 /10 Overall, Looks pretty good. Could easily be animated for a server.
6.Proportion
10 Points 7/10 It is good on the proportion, But some areas have unneeded faces, Causeing it to appear flat. And on the shoulders, There is too much of a edge.
7.Detail
10 Points 9/10 It would be nice to see some uniqe detail on a barrow brother, Maybe a blue crystal on a shoulder?[/quote]

Way to clean to be primitive free.

Read full topic
